docs.snippet: After a cramped event at Radio City Music Hall, the N.F.L. is considering other locations, as well as the addition of a fourth day and other changes....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a cramped event at Radio City Music Hall, the N.F.L. is considering other locations, as well as the addition of a fourth day and other changes.
docs.abstract: NFL will not decide until late summer where 2015 draft will take place, but Commissioner Roger Goodell says league is considering several changes, including expanding the event to four days and moving part or all of it to another location; Radio City Music Hall has hosted nine consecutive drafts.

headline.main: Questions About N.F.L. Draft’s Future Involve Location, Date and Length
headline.print_headline: Questions About Draft’s Future Center on Site, Date and Length

docs.snippet: Prompted by concern about brain injuries, the school board in the city of Marshall, in the gridiron hotbed of East Texas, eliminated the tackle-football program for seventh graders without much protest....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prompted by concern about brain injuries, the school board in the city of Marshall, in the gridiron hotbed of East Texas, eliminated the tackle-football program for seventh graders without much protest.
docs.abstract: School board in city of Marshall in East Texas eliminates tackle-football program for seventh graders; move, and lack of protest from community, highlights changing attitude toward the sport as awareness of concussions and brain trauma penetrates into the very heartland of football.

headline.main: Football’s Risks Sink In, Even in Heart of Texas
headline.print_headline: Football’s Risks Sink In, Even in Heart of Texas

docs.snippet: The selection of Michael Sam by the St. Louis Rams late in the final round of the N.F.L. draft may have saved the league from another public relations problem....
docs.lead_paragraph: The selection of Michael Sam by the St. Louis Rams late in the final round of the N.F.L. draft may have saved the league from another public relations problem.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column argues that defensive end Michael Sam, first openly gay NFL draftee who was selected by the St Louis Rams late in the final round of the 2014 draft, should have been taken three rounds earlier; holds league cannot acknowledge Southeastern Conference as best college football conference and then let one of its top players be drafted behind kickers and players from obscure programs in obscure conferences.

headline.seo: Too Long a Wait for Michael Sam at the N.F.L. Draft

docs.snippet: Quarterback Philip Nelson was arrested in Mankato in connection with an assault on a linebacker for Minnesota State University, Mankato....
docs.lead_paragraph: Quarterback Philip Nelson was arrested in Mankato in connection with an assault on a linebacker for Minnesota State University, Mankato.
docs.abstract: Rutgers University quarterback Philip Nelson is arrested in Mankato, Minn, and charged with third-degree assault on Minnesota State University linebacker Isaac Kolstad, who is in critical condition.

headline.main: Rutgers Player Is Charged With Assault in Minnesota
headline.print_headline: Rutgers Player Is Charged With Assault in Minnesota

docs.snippet: A stampede at a soccer stadium in Congo's capital killed at least 15 people after angry fans threw rocks from the stands, prompting security officers to fire tear gas that caused crowds to flee in panic, government officials and witnesses said Mon...
docs.lead_paragraph: A stampede at a soccer stadium in Congo's capital killed at least 15 people after angry fans threw rocks from the stands, prompting security officers to fire tear gas that caused crowds to flee in panic, government officials and witnesses said Monday.

headline.main: Congo Soccer Stadium Stampede Kills at Least 15
headline.print_headline: Congo Soccer Stadium Stampede Kills at Least 15
